title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3 JUVENILE JUSTICE

description.narrative: Output 2.3 (Juvenile Justice): By 2020, the social sector institutions and local authorities will have operational models with which to apply comprehensive protection specialist intervention models against all forms of violence risk and humanitarian response management and local comprehensive protection monitoring systems., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2 (Comprehensive Protection): By 2020, children and adolescents will have a comprehensive system for protecting their rights plus comprehensive protection and violence reduction policies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3 (Juvenile Justice): By 2020, the social sector institutions and local authorities will have operational models withwhich to apply comprehensive protection; specialist intervention models against all forms of violence; risk and humanitarianresponse management; and local comprehensive protection monitoring systems.

description.narrative: PCO contributed to guarantee the rights of youth in conflict with the law by monitoring the situation of adolescents deprived of their liberty and capacity building for the implementation and best use of the manuals and protocols for alternative forms of justice and restorative justice practices developed previously. Technical capacities of the Ministry of Government were strengthened to adapt its services in the context of the pandemic to ensure protection of adolescents deprived of their liberty, by establishing protocols for action for the prevention and detection of Covid-19. Operationalized national/sub-national emergency alternative care plans to address Covid-19 are available. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2021
